items.sentence: I don\'t get to Boston as often as I\'d like.
I\'m looking forward to having some time off.
I\'m looking forward to seeing you in Boston.
Tom already knows that Mary wants to do that.
Tom barely avoided crashing into Mary\'s car.
Tom wasn\'t sure what Mary wanted him to buy.
How many more months will Tom stay in Boston?
Don\'t you want to know who those people are?
Is it true that you wanted to live in Boston?
Tom told me that he wasn\'t afraid of snakes.
Do you think I don\'t know about you and Tom?
This umbrella is mine and that one\'s Tom\'s.
Why did you think I didn\'t enjoy doing that?
Why do you think I\'d do something like that?
I\'ve already waited for almost half an hour.
You\'re Tom Jackson\'s daughter, aren\'t you?
Tom waited impatiently for Mary to get ready.
I wish you didn\'t hang out with Tom so much.
I wish you\'d consider coming back to Boston.
I wish you\'d stop calling me your boyfriend.
